meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or value
meanings.sent1: The bankruptcy spoliated him of all his assets, leaving him with nothing.
meanings.sent2: The fire seemed to spoliate the house of all its memories and belongings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog managed to spoliate the living room of its decorations.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis threatened to spoliate the country of its financial stability.
meanings.sent5: The floodwaters continued to spoliate the farmland, causing significant losses to the farmers.
